On a freezing Wednesday, I brought food from next-door Carolina Kitchen, ate while warming up in the theater lobby, then watched a great movie. The theater validates parking in nearby garages for the first two hours.

Nice movie theater in a wonderful location with a nice selection of food and snacks. Very clean and we were able to get great seats!

Went here to see Trainwreck. The seats were very comfortable and the view of the screen was above-average. Very easy to get to from the metro.

Visited here to see a classic film. Sound was fine and seats were comfortable. I would go back if ever in the area again. Very handy to Chinatown Metro stop.

This theater was located a few blocks from our hotel in Chinatown. The theater was clean and like all movie theaters the food was very expensive but I do recommend this place if you would like to see a movie while in Washington DC.

Good clean with excellent sound and vision. easy to find and friendly staff. seats comfortable and roomy.

They're all pretty much the same. This is one gets "very good" from me because it is located right at the Gallery Place Metro station exit. Just turn right on 7th street when you exit the station at street level. It's about a half a block on the right. Even on vacation, I sometimes like to catch up on movies...


More  



We wanted to see a movie on Thanksgiving and happened upon this theatre complex as we wandered through Chinatown. The area is reached easily by Metro (Gallery Place) and the theatre is house with a variety of shops and places to eat...the staff was pleasant and the place was clean...we had a good visit.

The movies are projected at a high quality and the staff is friendly and helpful. It's an easily accessible location and is our preferred spot for movies in DC.

This theater is clean, safe, has real food for sale and not just your traditional junk food that your movie theater carries. I had an amazing time tonight seeing Guardians of the Galaxy. If you need a place that is vibrant and fun to hang out with friends, I would highly recommend it! WAS AWESOME and METRO ACCESSIBLE!

title: Loews Uptown Theatre, Washington DC
address: 3426 Connecticut Ave, NW, Washington DC, DC 20008
review_list:
Longtime Washingtonians like to wax nostalgic about the Uptown, myself included (I saw Star Wars here in 1977). And with the closing of KB Cinema on Wisconsin in 2005, the Uptown is the sole surviving big screen in the city. Don’t let this fact draw you here; what could have been the grande dame of DC cinema is instead a...


More  



A group of us went to see Mission Impossible Sunday 8/9 at 4:10. I mention this because the people working at that time and after were the best! The popcorn was popped before our eyes, warm, and tasty. The theater was clean/neat and everything was perfect for movie viewing. It was, however, after the movie that we found out just...


More  



The Uptown is one of the last of the really big screen movie houses — The Last in this city — where the movie goer's experience is immersive and one can almost feel lost in the scene.

The only theater left with one gigantic screen, while others have been turned into multiplexes -- and this even has a balcony, where I think audiences get the best view. It's a great old-time theater, with a history of grand openings of first-run films.

Wouldn't know it was there but very accessible and great nearby options for dinner before or good concession options in house.
Bathroom is a bit out of the way, so go before the show.

While not one of the old "glamour" cinemas, the Uptown is an excellent place to experience an old-school viewing of film. View first-run movies on a HUGE screen, either from not-terribly comfortable orchestra or balcony seating. Avg-good concessions are available.

We went to see "Girl with a dragon tattoo". Great Theatre, plenty of seating!

I am a 25 year old female.

We dropped in Habana Village for a drink and one friend who loves salsa dancing. It was a bit small where they were dancing and we didn't try the food, but the atmosphere was decent.

I went here to learn how to salsa. The instructor was very nice and awesome. She teaches you the correct way to do salsa. I had enough skills to hang with the big league dancers. I really enjoyed myself.

The toys had missing parts: train tracks but no train, play workbench without tools, sand table without sand, etc. We spent an hour there and it was a struggle to find enough to do. It was definitely NOT WORTH the time or admission price.

This place is great for the kids, the money to get in is money well spent good for the ages of (3-5).
